thread.title: Record-setting day of postseason homers
thread.title_full: Record-setting day of postseason homers - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: Record-setting day of postseason homers
text:
Photo: Charles Rex Arbogast, AP Image 1 of / 2   2 St. Louis Cardinals' Stephen Piscotty (55) hits a home run against the Chicago Cubs during the ninth inning of Game 3 in baseball's National League Division Series, Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in Chicago. The Cubs won 8-6.
Photo: Charles Rex Arbogast, AP St. Louis Cardinals' Stephen Piscotty (55) hits a home run against... Image 2 of 2 Chicago Cubs center fielder Dexter Fowler (24) hits a home run against the St. Louis Cardinals during the eighth inning of Game 3 in baseball's National League Division Series, Monday, Oct. 12, 2015, in Chicago.
Photo: Charles Rex Arbogast, AP Chicago Cubs center fielder Dexter Fowler (24) hits a home run... Record-setting day of postseason homers 1  /  2 Back to Gallery From Carlos Correa to Adrian Gonzalez , baseball's sluggers are having quite a day.
There have been 20 home runs Monday, a record for one day in postseason play. The latest was a solo shot by Gonzalez in the seventh inning for the Los Angeles Dodgers in their NL Division Series game against the New York Mets .
Correa hit two of Houston's four homers against Kansas City, and the Chicago Cubs hit a postseason-record six home runs in their victory over St. Louis. Three of Toronto's first eight batters homered in an ALDS win at Texas.
The previous postseason record was 15 home runs on Oct. 3, 1995, according to STATS. Like Monday, there were four postseason games on that day 20 years ago.
